<<<api>>>: ApplicationInfo.loadIcon
<<<code>>>: 
List<ResolveInfo> list = packageManager.queryIntentActivities(new Intent(Intent.ACTION_MAIN, null).addCategory(Intent.CATEGORY_LAUNCHER), 0);
for (ResolveInfo info : list) {
    String packageName = info.activityInfo.packageName;
    String appName = info.loadLabel(packageManager).toString();
    Drawable appIcon = info.activityInfo.loadIcon(packageManager);
    // Do something with appName and appIcon
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code above retrieves all activities that can be launched from the home screen (i.e., they respond to the "android.intent.action.MAIN" action and belong to the "android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" category). For each such activity, it retrieves the package name, the app name, and the app icon. This way, if a package contains multiple launchable activities, each of them will be processed separately.
